cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with algorithms for solving optimization problems in Markov Decision Processes (MDPs), which are typically studied in the subfield of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The use of polynomial time algorithms suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also involves the use of probabilistic polynomial equations, which may be relevant to the subfield of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper's focus on optimization and decision-making in MDPs suggests that it may also be relevant to the subfield of Control Systems (cs.SY). Finally, the paper's mention of game theory and the complexity of computing optimal strategies suggests that it may also be relevant to the subfield of Theoretical Computer Science (cs.GT).
